definition: magistrate (during Tang and Song dynasties)/mythological underworld judge

sentences.english: He retorted, "Who made you chief and ruler over us?
sentences.chinese: 那人說“誰立你作我們的首領和審判官呢？

sentences.english: Hong Kong's chief magistrate Tong Man flew over for the session.
sentences.chinese: 香港裁判官唐文只好飛來加拿大。

sentences.english: Chapter four is discussed to the artful way of making up the judge images in the vernacular courtcase stories.
sentences.chinese: 第四章探討白話公案小說中判官形象塑造的藝術手法。

sentences.english: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這是大罪，是審判官當罰的罪孽。

sentences.english: However, Magistrate Tong ruled out suspending the sentence owing to the seriousness of the crime.
sentences.chinese: 不過，裁判官由於罪行的嚴重性不判決緩刑。

sentences.english: Executioners and judges have worn masks to avoid retaliation.
sentences.chinese: 死刑執行者及審判官也穿戴面具，預防被罪犯報復。

sentences.english: There is always something the Judge can never accept or forgive.
sentences.chinese: 總是會有些事是我們內心的判官無法接受或原諒的。

sentences.english: We ourselves are the better judges.
sentences.chinese: 我們自己就是很好的判官。

sentences.english: That Israelite rebukes him and says, who set you up as a judge over us?
sentences.chinese: 這個以色列人就非難他說，誰立你作我們的審判官？

sentences.english: The actual manager of the official capital money was the subordinate under the executive officer.
sentences.chinese: 至於本錢的實際經營者，則是判官之下的屬吏或屬司。

sentences.english: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.
sentences.chinese: 他把謀士剝衣擄去，又使審判官變成愚人。

sentences.english: The extinctive prescription system stems from praetor-law of ancient Rome.
sentences.chinese: 消滅時效制度源自古羅馬裁判官法。

sentences.english: He became one of the first Inquisitors of the New Order.
sentences.chinese: 他成爲最早的新秩序裁判官之一。

sentences.english: In life, she will be very good in providing her services as a mediator or judge.
sentences.chinese: 在生活中，天秤座的女非常善於做調解人或者是判官。
審判官判決了這個案子。

sentences.english: By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 王子和首領，世上一切的審判官，都是藉我掌權。

definition: Yama, King of Hell/translation of Sanskrit: Yama Raja
same as 閻羅王|阎罗王/Yama, King of Hell/translation of Sanskrit: Yama Raja
official registrar (of a county etc) in imperial China
imperial censor (formal title of a dynastic official)
prefectural magistrate (during Tang to Qing times)
county magistrate (during Tang to Qing times)
